dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: I'd love to hear about your time in the Peace Corps.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, the Peace Corps. It was a long time ago, but I remember it well. I went to Ghana. It was my first time leaving the country.

sentence_annotations.text: Ah, the Peace Corps. It was a long time ago, but I remember it well. I went to Ghana. It was my first time leaving the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like that experience in Ghana must have been quite impactful. What was it like adjusting to a new culture for the first time?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: It was definitely an adjustment. The culture was vibrant and welcoming, but there were challenging moments too, like adapting to the climate and language barriers.

sentence_annotations.text: The culture was vibrant and welcoming, but there were challenging moments too, like adapting to the climate and language barriers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That must have been hard, especially with the language barriers. How did you manage to communicate effectively with the locals?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: Well, I picked up some basic phrases in Twi and Ewe, and the locals were patient with me. They taught me a lot. It was humbling, really.

sentence_annotations.text: I picked up some basic phrases in Twi and Ewe, and the locals were patient with me.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: So when did things change for you after the Peace Corps?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: After the Peace Corps, I came back to the States and started teaching. It was around the time of the protests in the late 60s, early 70s. The atmosphere was charged, you know.

sentence_annotations.text: After the Peace Corps, I came back to the States and started teaching.
It was around the time of the protests in the late 60s, early 70s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That period was full of significant changes and challenges. How did you find stepping into teaching during such a tumultuous time?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: It was quite the experience. The classroom was a microcosm of the world outside. Students were passionate and vocal about their beliefs. It was a time when education wasn't just about textbooks but about real-world issues.

sentence_annotations.text: It was quite the experience. The classroom was a microcosm of the world outside.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That sounds intense. What were some of the core challenges you faced as a teacher during that time?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: Balancing the curriculum with students' demands to discuss current events was tricky. Some parents were supportive, but others thought I was overstepping. Then there were the protests outside the school; sometimes it felt like teaching was the least of my responsibilities.

sentence_annotations.text: Balancing the curriculum with students' demands to discuss current events was tricky. Some parents were supportive, but others thought I was overstepping.
Then there were the protests outside the school; sometimes it felt like teaching was the least of my responsibilities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That must have been quite a balancing act. How did you cope with the pressures and expectations from all sides?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: I tried to listen to everyone and find a middle ground. It wasn't easy, though. Some days were tougher than others.

sentence_annotations.text: I tried to listen to everyone and find a middle ground.
Some days were tougher than others.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That sounds like a lot to juggle. How did the protests outside the school impact your teaching methods or the classroom environment?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: The protests definitely brought a sense of urgency to everything. I had to be flexible with my lesson plans, sometimes addressing the events happening right outside our windows. It was important to make the students feel heard and safe.

sentence_annotations.text: The protests definitely brought a sense of urgency to everything. I had to be flexible with my lesson plans, sometimes addressing the events happening right outside our windows. It was important to make the students feel heard and safe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: I'd love to hear about what you've been up to more recently. Have you been working on any projects or hobbies?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, I've been writing my memoirs. It's something I've wanted to do for a long time.

sentence_annotations.text: Yes, I've been writing my memoirs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That sounds like a rewarding endeavor. How has the process of writing your memoirs been for you?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: It's been interesting. Reflecting on my life, I can see how things connected in ways I didn't notice at the time. It's given me a sense of closure.

sentence_annotations.text: Reflecting on my life, I can see how things connected in ways I didn't notice at the time. It's given me a sense of closure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That sounds like a meaningful process. Have you discovered anything about yourself through writing that has surprised you?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: I suppose I've realized how resilient I've been through different phases of my life. There were challenges that seemed insurmountable at the time, but looking back, I see how they shaped me.

sentence_annotations.text: I suppose I've realized how resilient I've been through different phases of my life. There were challenges that seemed insurmountable at the time, but looking back, I see how they shaped me.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: Before we finish, if you had to share one lesson from your life experiences with future generations, what would it be?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: I'd say, embrace change. It's often uncomfortable, but it's where growth happens. And always listen, truly listen, to those around you.

sentence_annotations.text: I'd say, embrace change. It's often uncomfortable, but it's where growth happens. And always listen, truly listen, to those around you.
